Description: Limestone ostracon: on recto and verso, and on one edge, a palimpsest, the earlier writing of respectively five, six and one lines of continuous text containing a letter to the vizier(?) by the foreman Hay. The later writing of five lines only on the recto contains a record ('snny') of wooden objects to be made for a superior by the foreman Khonsu.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: K.Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' V (Oxford, 1983), 583-4; E.F. Wente, 'Letters from Ancient Egypt' (Atlanta, 1990), p.50, no.55; S.Allam, 'Hieratische Ostraka und Papyri aus der Ramessidenzeit' (Tubingen, 1973), no.223, p.224; J. J. Černy and A.H. Gardiner, ‘Hieratic Ostraca’ (Oxford 1957), p. 13 and pl. XLIV, 1.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136395) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136395)
